title: [IOTDB-3645] Fix use statistics bug in aggregation query
Make InconsistentDataException as a RuntimeException
[IOTDB-3262]Remove memory control info of MTreeAboveSG
body:
## Description


### Motivation

The memory statistic warning was reported by MTreeAboveSG used in configNode. 

There was memory control mechanism in MemMTreeStore to record the memory usage of memory MTree. MTreeAboveSG used this. In configNode, the memory statistic cannot get the memory threshold from IoTDBConfig, which results in the threshold always being 0, so comes the warning.

The MTreeAboveSG use the MemMTreeStore to help adapt to the MTree Traverser, and there's no need to statistic the memory of MTreeAboveSG since the number of storage group is small. 

### Modification

Avoid using the write interface provided by MemMTreeStore which is bounded with the memory statistic.

title: [To rel/0.13]Deactivation and Privilege for Schema Template
body:
## Backgroud
Since feature of schema template is released with Apache IoTDB v0.13, several issues about it have been put forward. Before this PR, if a user needs to unset a template which has been activated from one node (means data has been inserted into the measuremnt inside the template),   the user has to delete the whole storage group first. This is a pretty weird practice as it is supposed to ban the unset of activated template in the very beginning. What's more, only `ROOT` user can utilize template as there is no privilege entry for template. This PR tackles these issues at once.

## Deactivation of Schema Template
When a node or its ancestor has been set a template on, it can be set using template by `create timeseries of schema template` or data insertion. Once a node is using template, it or its ancestor on which has been set template cannot unset the template until a deactivation issued. And the deactivation mentioned above, can be issued by statement `deactivate schema tempalte <template> from <path> ` or interface `deactivateTemplate` in `Session`.

## Privilege of Schema Template
Two more privilege entry has been added to handle authority of schema template. `UPDATE_TEMPLATE` is an entry independent of path and stands for create, drop, append and prune of any schema template. `APPLY_TEMPLATE` is a dependent one which stands for set, unset and activate of schema template on the authorized paths. As long as the deactivation may delete the corresponding time series data points, it is authorized by the entry `DELETE_TIMESERIES`.

body:

- Increase `maxWaitingTimeForAccumulatingBatchInMs` in order to reduce the number of RPCs because generally the concurrency of a single region is not high.
- Decrease `maxPendingRequestNumPerNode` to reduce memory footprint.

title: [IOTDB-3635][IOTDB-3583] Increase the stability of the getLeader interface
body: ConsensusManager's getLeader interface returns the result for the consensusLayer. However, the consensusLayer's getLeader interface may return null when the consensusLayer is on leader election or when ConfigNode isn't added to any consensusGroup. Therefore, this PR optimizes the stability logic of the ConsensusManager's getLeader interface.

title: [To rel/0.12][IOTDB-3602] Skip empty TsFile when loading directory
Pre-commit-hooks for dev
body:
Hi my IoTDB friends!👋

🎉After spending days on the git hooks mechanism, the pre-commit hooks for us developers is ready now! 🎉

## Description

The pre-commit hooks enable auto checks before commits. So next time a single `git commit` should do all the style checks automatically.

Currently, the support functionalities are:
* Turn on/off the hook in local config files.
* Auto `mvn spotless:apply` before commits
* Auto `mvn validate` before commits
* Smart selection of only the changed modules for validation

## Installation

All the files are under `tools/git-hooks`.

### Windows

Double click the `install.ps1`, and allow to execute in admin mode. Make sure that the Git for Windows is the default git on Windows.

**Note**: Windows support is based on the [Git for Windows](https://gitforwindows.org/), which provide a minimal shell environment called Git Bash. Actually, all these hooks on Windows are executed under the Git Bash environment, so the hook script can be somewhat platform-independent.

### Unix

```
./install.sh
```

## Configuration

After installation, a `config.sh` shall be created. Modification to the `config.sh` file would take effect the next time you commit.

All the configurable options is in `config.sample.sh`.

```sh
# enable the pre-commit hooks, 0 - off, 1 - on
export IOTDB_GIT_HOOKS=1
# maven path
# If in Git Bash, replace all '\' to '/', and change the driver path from 'C:\' to '/c/
# No escape character is needed.
# Example:
#   export IOTDB_MAVEN_PATH="/c/Program Files/apache-maven-3.6/bin/mvn"
export IOTDB_MAVEN_PATH="mvn"
# git path
# If in Git Bash, see 'IOTDB_MAVEN_PATH'
export IOTDB_GIT_PATH="git"
# smart select the changed java module, 0 - off, 1 - on
export IOTDB_SMART_JAVA_MODULES=1
# auto spotless:apply, 0 - off, 1 - on
export IOTDB_SPOTLESS_APPLY=0
# maven validate, 0 - off, 1 - on
export IOTDB_VALIDATE=1
# 0 - discard all, 1 - logs on errors, 2 - stdout, 3 - stdout & logs on errors
export IOTDB_VERBOSE=2
```

**Note 1 for Windows user**: If you are on Windows, pay attention to the `IOTDB_MAVEN_PATH` and `IOTDB_GIT_PATH`. Since the hook script is executed under Git Bash, you must make sure the Git Bash could get to the maven & git binary file correctly. The path expression in Git Bash is slightly different from Windows. Check the examples in config file carefully.

**Note 2 for Windows user**: The easiest way to handle these binary path is to put them into the %PATH% environment variable in Windows. Then the default configuration should work well.

## Uninstall

See `uninstall.ps1` and `uninstall.sh`.

## Pipeline

The overall pipeline of the hook script:
1. `IOTDB_GIT_HOOKS` checks if the hook is on
2. `IOTDB_SMART_JAVA_MODULES` to select only the changed modules
3. `IOTDB_SPOTLESS_APPLY` runs `mvn spotless:apply`
4. `IOTDB_VALIDATE` runs `mvn validate` or `mvn -pl <changed_modules> validate`

The hook is tested on both Linux and Windows.

## Doc

Not sure where to place the entire documentation. Any suggestion?

title: [IOTDB-3509] Read/Write Routing Policy (Routing to leader)
body:
This routing policy work as the following process:

1. ConfigNode-leader asks all DataNodes to judge its RegionGroups' leader in every 5s
2. ConfigNode-leader pick RegionGroup's leader as the first choice, then sort other Replicas by their loadScores for read/write requests.

title: [IOTDB-3589] Fix dataRegion cannot recover from snapshot
body:
See [IOTDB-3589](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3589).
Before this PR, data region takes snapshot without a directory structure, the info is stored in the filename, which is not elegant. This PR changes the way DataRegion creates snapshots which has a directory structure, and changes how DataRegion loads snapshot.

[IOTDB-3584] Snapshot unstable due to segment size
body:
When 400000 raft logs append, Ratis will ask statemachine to take a snapshot and purge the logs.
Currently, log segment size is 8MB, which means 400000 logs will add to 10000+ logs files, and purge them will take up to 10 seconds, which is longer enough to cause the current leader to step down.
Therefore, in this PR I change to segment size to 128 MB to reduce file numbers and corresponding purge time.

title: [IOTDB-3549] Fix delete data in new standalone
body:
## Description


### Cause

The implementation of delete data for cluster mode use the slotId to get dataPartition. Although this saves the duplicated device slotId calculation, the standalonePartitionFetcher doesn't support this.

### Solution

Use device path to get data partition in new standalone.

### Future work

Make the behavior of partition fetcher and configNode of standalone consistent with those of cluster

title: Optimize write and MPP framework
body:
## Description
1. Remove some duplicated log
2. Fix the issue that `getStatus()` will be queued for a long while (50-70ms)
3. Fix the issue that the thread is occupied when sleeping in QueryTerminator, which lead to the task in same thread-pool will be queued for a long while to waiting the thread being released.
4. The write operation is changed to Sync using client thread. (The testing is in progress and the async write won't be discard)

After this change, the write throughput in 1C1D is similar with new-standalone.

body:

The device-based granularity is used to check the target file size, because when below this granularity, the concurrency control of the sub compaction threads will be considered, which is more complicated.

title: [IOTDB-3522] Set heartbeat as a periodic scheduled task
body:
See [IOTDB-3522](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3522).

Changes:
* Add `start()` and `stop()` methods to `LoadManager`
* Remove `Runnable` interface in `LoadManager`
* Replace previous blocking `sleep()` with `ScheduledExecutorUtil.unsafelyScheduleWithFixedDelay()`

title: [IOTDB-3522] Set heartbeat as a periodic scheduled task
body:
See [IOTDB-3522](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3522).

Changes:
* Add `start()` and `stop()` methods to `LoadManager`
* Remove `Runnable` interface in `LoadManager`
* Replace previous blocking `sleep()` with `ScheduledExecutorUtil.unsafelyScheduleWithFixedDelay()`

title: Accelerate New Cluster IT
[IOTDB-3428] Linear expanse RegionGroup(simple version)
body:
The following two scenarios trigger RegionGroup expansion:

1. When a StorageGroup writes schema/data for the first time, initialize a SchemaRegionGroup/DataRegionGroup for it.
2. When a StorageGroup writes schema/data continuously, extend some SchemaRegionGroups/DataRegionGroups until its _slotCount\regionCount <= maxSlotCount\maxRegionCount_.

The following two scenarios trigger the adjustment of maxRegionGroupCount:

1. Register/Remove DataNode.
2. Set/Delete StorageGroup.

See [maxRegionGroupCount](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccnHuDkDD6RiwLjaej3hkA9Vb#whSIka) for detailed adjustment formulas.

title: [IOTDB-3189] Fix compaction is not well-distributed across sgs
body:
See [IOTDB-3189](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3189).

In present IoTDB compaction task submitted order set by the `ICompactionTaskComparator`, currently this interface only has `DefaultCompactionTaskComparator` an implementation. `DefaultCompactionTaskComparator` compares the compaction task priority with following several aspects:
- Whether the compaction priority of the system is Balance. If not, the prior one is inner space task or cross space task.
- For inner space compaction, compare whether the tasks are sequence, compaction task level,compaction files version number, total number of compaction files, and total size of compaction files
- For cross space compaction, compare the total number of files and the total size of them.
- 
Different storage groups are not considered in this comparison. Therefore, when the tasks of different storage groups are compared side by side, it is easy to create uneven storage combinations. For example, if two SG groups commit a large number of compacton tasks in the sequence space with the same number of files, the same file size, and the same file level, the system may compact tasks in only one storage group due to the different submission timing.

To balance compaction tasks between different storage groups, when all other things being equal, each compaction task can be assigned a unique serial id that is counted individually by each virtual storage group and monotonically increases from zero. If two compaction tasks are from different storage groups, their sequence numbers are compared; the compaction task with a smaller sequence number has a higher priority. After adjustment, compaction priority comparison becomes
- Whether the compaction priority of the system is Balance. If not, the prior one is inner space task or cross space task.
- For inner space compaction, compare whether the tasks are sequence, compaction task level,compaction files version number, total number of compaction files, the serial number of compaction tasks, and the total size of files
- For a cross space compaction, compare the total number of compaction files, the sequence number of compaction tasks, and the total size of files.

title: [IOTDB-3512] Region leader during heartbeat
[To rel/0.13] make operation sync cover all protocols
body: Move operation sync related from TSServiceImpl to ServiceProvider to cover all protocols, such as RPC, MQTT, and Influxdb protocol. Test sync MQTT insertions.

title: [IOTDB-3521] Procedure doesn't start when ConfigNode set the consensus protocol to StandAlone
body: See description of [IOTDB-3521](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-3521)

title: Print sql and corresponding QueryId
Fix the issue that the QueryExecution may not be released
body:
## Description
1. In DataBlockServiceImpl, the target fragment instance may not be found because of finishing before receiving the event, which is possible. So we need to handle this scenario rather than throw Exception here.
2. In ClusterSchemaFetcher, we need to ensure the QueryExecution is always be removed so we use `try-finally` here to avoid runtime exception.
